sources.title: Missouri Traveler
sources.description: Brandon De Wilde plays a runaway orphan in a story set in the early 20th century. Lee Marvin has a prominent role. Unfortunately, there was a continuous logo or watermark that had to be obscured.

sources.title: The Missouri Traveler (1958) BRANDON DE WILDE ♠ LEE MARVIN
sources.description:
It's Friday@PizzaFLIX
Stars: Brandon De Wilde, Lee Marvin, Gary Merrill
Director: Jerry Hopper

During the early 1900s, a runaway orphan reaches a town with townsfolk who become enchanted by him. A wealthy rancher and a newspaperman compete to give him an education.

TRIVIA: Philanthropist Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney produced a trilogy of films in what he called his “American Series," The Searchers (1956,) The Missouri Traveler (1958,) and The Young Land (1959).

metadata.Plot: A runaway orphan, Biarn Turner (De Wilde), attempts to escape his troubles by traveling to Florida during the early 1900's. He finds his way to a small town where the local newspaper editor, Doyle Magee (Merrill), decides to take the boy in and give him a chance at a regular life. Wealthy local farmer, Tobias Brown (Marvin), also takes an interest in Biarn's future, but he treats the young man harshly, masking Tobias' real hidden feelings of affection and genuine concern. Biarn's mannerisms and willingness to help others, quickly wins the favor of the local townsfolk; And he also proves his worth by preparing a seemingly untrainable horse for a race that the town will hold during their annual 4th of July celebration.
metadata.Actors: Brandon De Wilde, Lee Marvin, Gary Merrill
